  |> or function shorthand \(...\) syntax added in R 4.1.0.

## R Package Dependency Check for tglkmeans

```R
Namespace in Imports field not imported from: ‘doRNG’
  All declared Imports should be used.
```

## Temporarily Registering doFuture Adapter with `with()`

```R
with(registerDoFuture(), {
  # Your foreach code here
})

# Or temporarily within a function:
my_function <- function() {
  with(registerDoFuture(), local = TRUE, {
    # Your foreach code here
  })
}
```

## Integrating doFuture with Foreach %dopar% using registerDoFuture()

```R
library(doFuture)
registerDoFuture()
plan(multisession)

y <- foreach(x = 1:4, y = 1:10) %dopar% {
  z <- x + y
  slow_sqrt(z)
}
```

## Parallelizing R Foreach Loops with %dofuture% Operator

```R
library(doFuture)
plan(multisession)

y <- foreach(x = 1:4, y = 1:10) %dofuture% {
  z <- x + y
  slow_sqrt(z)
}
```

## Ensuring Consistent Random Number Generation with `withDoRNG()`

```R
withDoRNG({
  # Your foreach %dopar% expression here
  # e.g., foreach(i = 1:10) %dopar% { rnorm(1) }
})
```

## Using the %dofuture% Operator for Parallel Execution

```R
y <- foreach(x = 1:3) %dofuture% { slow_fcn(x) }
```

## Configuring %dopar% to Behave as %dofuture% with `flavor`

```R
registerDoFuture(flavor = "%dofuture%")
```
